description: Numbers n such that 6*7^n -1 is prime.
references: R. K. Guy, Unsolved Problems in Number Theory, Section A3.
H. C. Williams, The primality of certain integers of the form 2Ar^n - 1, Acta Arith. 39 (1981), 7-17.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: One more term from Jason Earls (zevi_35711(AT)yahoo.com), Jul 21 2001
More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 17 2003
One more term from _Ryan Propper_, Jun 05 2006
